Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Seko1900> everyone ATTN: Dear users, there was a scammer –ö–æmodo NewsBot#2758 sending direct messages to users about Agama and KomodoOceanQT wallet update. Please don't click on those links, nor download them to keep yourself and your funds safe. The scammer is using github link https://github.com/KomodoPlatforms. Notice the extra s at the end. The original/real org repo URL doesn't have this https://github.com/KomodoPlatform. If you have a github account, please report the repo and the user and hopefully github will remove the phishing repo(s).
Please remember, we will never send you DM about software updates. If there is any update we will post it on our website and in the official channel.
The scammer is banned from this discord and thanks to user Oink for reporting. Here is how the message looks like:

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> It's important to remember that even in open source communities not everything is free. It may be free to use as an end user, like Hyperdex, Atomicdex, Utrum, Chameleon, Komodod, and countless other software in the Komodo community, but it isn't free to create.
Even volunteer developer time has costs TO THE DEVELOPER! That is time they don't get to spend with their families and friends, or working for pay. But are instead providing their skills and time to ensure people all over the world have access to top software and financial freedom.
With that said it should be understood that the basic model for open source software is that the core functionality is free to use, fork, alter etc. But there are premium versions that are SOLD. This is to help the ecosystem survive by ensuring that those devs and others get some compensation for their work, or at the VERY LEAST, cover the costs of infrastructure for the free software.
What you see in those screenshots is community members donating KMD to HyperDEX, a desktop DEX using AtomicAPI. HyperDEX is funded by hyperDEX (the person) out of their own pockets, in order to provide this awesome software.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar>

https://github.com/atomiclabs/hyperdex/blob/master/README.md#donate

Even volunteer developer time has costs TO THE DEVELOPER! That is time they don't get to spend with their families and friends, or working for pay. But are instead providing their skills and time to ensure people all over the world have access to top software and financial freedom.
With that said it should be understood that the basic model for open source software is that the core functionality is free to use, fork, alter etc. But there are premium versions that are SOLD. This is to help the ecosystem survive by ensuring that those devs and others get some compensation for their work, or at the VERY LEAST, cover the costs of infrastructure for the free software.
